CatDescriptText: B.J. Anthony, parking lot attendant, Fineview and Ann W. Woods, housewife, East End, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, May 21, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that racket squads eliminate vice and crime?" Mr. Anthony's answer reads: "They will never eliminate vice and crime, but will reduce it to a certain extent."  Mrs.Woods's answer reads: "If a racket squad is properly handled, it will do much to reduce crime and vice."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of B.J. Anthony wearing dark jacket with patch, eyeglasses, and dark hat with brim, standing in front of column with flared top; Portrait of Ann W. Woods wearing dress with pleated skirt, corsage, and light colored gloves, standing on Liberty Avenue with Gateway Center in background, Downtown
